did.abstract: A collection of materials on the Breen Lodge. Materials include correspondence to and from the University Faculty Committee to the then President of Xavier University the Rev. Robert W. Mulligan, S.J. concerning the status of Breen Lodge on the Xavier University campus. Also included are documents of the University Senate, selected issues of the Xavier student newspaper and other ephemera

bioghist.head: History of Breen Lodge
bioghist.p: Breen Lodge was a women's center established in 1970 and closed during the presidency of Fr. Robert Mulligan in the spring of 1980. The center, which had become a popular institution at Xavier, had sponsored programming on women's issues for a decade. The announcement of its closing resulted in a students' rally to save Breen. [Source: Fortin, Roger. To See Great Wonders: a History of Xavier University, 1831-2006, pp. 322-323]
The documents in this collection reflect the reactions of the faculty Senate to the closing and the interaction between the Faculty Committee and the university president.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials on the former womens' center Breen Lodge. Materials include correspondence to and from the University Faculty to the President of Xavier University the Rev. Robert W. Mulligan, S.J. concerning the status of Breen Lodge on the Xavier University campus. Also include are documents from the University Senate, selected issues of the Xavier student newspaper the Xavier News, and other materials.

arrangement.head: Statement of Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into six folders by material type.

custodhist.p: Materials were in the possession of Dr. John Getz who formerly was a member of the Faculty Committee at the time of the closure of Breen Lodge.
